'''Sandslash''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''サンドパン''' ''Sandpan'') is a {{type|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Sandshrew}} starting at [[level]] 22.

In [[Alola]], Sandslash has a [[regional variant]] that is {{2t|Ice|Steel}}. It evolves from Alolan Sandshrew when exposed to an [[Ice Stone]].

==Biology==
Sandslash is a bipedal, ground dwelling {{wp|pangolin|pholidote}} Pokémon. Although Sandslash is usually bipedal, it can run on all fours. Most of its underside is light yellow with a white underbelly. It has a narrow muzzle, almond-shaped blue eyes, and a thick tail. Its back is mostly covered in sharp, brown quills formed from its tough, dry hide. It has two large claws on its paws and feet. These claws are its primary weapons, and are used for slashing. They can also be used for burrowing. Its claws and spikes can both break off and are shed regularly, but grow back quickly. It can curl into a large ball to protect its white underbelly. In this position, it can roll to attack or escape and protect itself from heatstroke. Sandslash is also adept at climbing trees, and is prone to ambush its enemies from above. Sandslash can mostly be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Rough-terrain Pokémon|deserts}}.

In the Alola region, Sandslash has an icy blue hide and quills covered in ice. These quills stand taller than a regular Sandslash's quills, and resemble icicles. This Pokémon uses its hide for camouflage in the snow, while leaving only its spines exposed. Its forepaws are larger than its counterpart, and its claws are longer, thinner, and hooked at the tips. Despite the weight of its ice-covered body, Alolan Sandslash is able to move swiftly by carving a path in the snow with its claws. This Pokémon tends to live in the deeper parts of snowy mountains, where climbing is forbidden. However, the sprays of snow it kicks up are popular shots for photographers.<ref>[http://www.pokemon-sunmoon.com/en-us/pokemon/alolan-sandslash/ Pokémon Sun and Moon]</ref>

==In the anime==
[[File:Jenaro Sandslash.png|thumb|250px|Sandslash in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===In the main series===
====Major appearances====
A Sandslash owned by [[Corey]] was one of the Pokémon captured and cloned by {{OBP|Mewtwo|original series}} in ''[[M01|Mewtwo Strikes Back]]''. When {{TRT}} saw it being cloned, it was mistaken for its pre-evolution, Sandshrew. The Sandslash clone was seen again in ''[[Mewtwo Returns]]''.

In ''[[EP141|Good 'Quil Hunting]]'', a Pokémon Trainer named [[Koji]] informed {{Ash}} about a place that was good for catching {{p|Cyndaquil}}. After Ash captured a Cyndaquil, the Trainer challenged Ash to a 1-on-1 Pokémon battle to determine who would keep the Cyndaquil. Koji used a Sandslash against [[Ash's Cyndaquil]] and lost.

In ''[[EP225|Bulbasaur... the Ambassador!]]'', several Sandslash helped dig a new lake for the {{type|Grass}} Pokémon at [[Professor Oak's Laboratory]].

In ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]'', Sandslash was a member of Team Razor Wind, along with {{p|Scyther}} and {{p|Zangoose}}. The trio of clawed Pokémon were first seen being blasted out of [[Wigglytuff's Guild]]. Team Razor Wind overheard that [[Team Poképals]] were assigned with the task of traveling to the Labyrinth Cave to get a {{p|Gabite}} Scale for an ailing {{p|Shinx}}, and decided to attempt beating [[Team Poképals]]. Unfortunately for Team Razor Wind, Gabite beat them up. It reappeared alongside its team in ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]''.

====Minor appearances====
Sandslash debuted in ''[[EP033|The Flame Pokémon-athon!]]''.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[EP047|A Chansey Operation]]'' as one of the injured Pokémon brought to the clinic.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[EP071|To Master the Onixpected]]''. It was stuck between the rocky body segments of [[Bruno's Onix|a giant Onix]] and causing so much pain that the Rock Snake Pokémon rampaged until [[Bruno]] freed it.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[EP075|Round One - Begin!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Trainer}} competing in the [[Indigo Plateau Conference]].

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]''.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[EP108|Pokémon Double Trouble]]''.

A Sandslash was part of the [[Pokémon Swap Meet]] in ''[[EP146|Tricks of the Trade]]''.

[[Pietra]] used her Sandslash for her digging project in ''[[EP204|Right On, Rhydon!]]''.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[M04|Celebi: The Voice of the Forest]]''.

A Sandslash was seen in the wild in ''[[The Legend of Thunder!]]''.

A Sandslash appeared in [[Nurse Joy]]'s poem in ''[[EP245|Will the Real Oak Please Stand Up?]]''.

A Sandslash made a brief cameo along with a {{p|Sandshrew}} in ''[[M07|Destiny Deoxys]]'' and ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

A Sandslash made a cameo in ''[[AG135|Numero Uno Articuno]]'' as a Pokémon belonging to {{FB|Factory Head|Noland}}.

A Sandslash appeared in the opening ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

In ''[[DP008|Gymbaliar!]]'', a Trainer used a Sandslash to battle a {{pkmn2|wild}} {{TP|Brock|Croagunk}} under Jessie's command.

Multiple Sandslash made a cameo in ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]''.

A group of Sandslash appeared in ''[[DP140|Historical Mystery Tour!]]''.

A Trainer's Sandslash appeared in ''[[BW103|Curtain Up, Unova League!]]''.

A Trainer's Sandslash appeared in ''[[SM001|Alola to New Adventure!]]'', during a flashback.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[SM003|Loading the Dex!]]'' as a silhouette that [[Rotom Pokédex]] brought up.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[M20|I Choose You!]]''.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Sandslash first appeared in ''[[PS043|Sea Sea Seadra]]'' where a wild Sandslash and Weezing appeared behind Bill still showing the ecology in [[Viridian Forest]] hasn't changed back to normal in two years.

In ''[[PS119|A Flaaffy Kerfuffle]]'' a Sandslash appeared where it was one of the Pokémon in {{adv|Professor Oak}}'s fantasy when he explains that trainers should only have six Pokémon with them.

Sandslash's most predominant appearance was in ''[[PS145|Sandslash Surprise]]''. While trying to find out their location, {{adv|Gold}} and {{adv|Silver}} are attacked by a swarm of spiky balls, which are revealed to be Sandslash fleeing from the wrath of {{p|Lugia}}.

Sandslash was also seen as one of the Pokémon used by [[Team Magma]], which first appeared in ''[[PS219|What Would You Do for a Whismur?]]''.

A Sandslash appeared in ''[[PAXY30|Pinsir Changes]]''.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Alolan Sandslash and its Alolan {{p|Sandshrew|pre-evolution}}.
* In the [[Pokémon Red and Green beta|Pokémon Red and Blue beta]], Sandslash's original name was "Sandstorm".
* Sandslash and its {{p|Sandshrew|pre-evolution}} share their {{pkmn|category}} with {{p|Rattata}}, {{p|Raticate}}, {{p|Pikachu}}, and {{p|Raichu}}. They are all known as the Mouse Pokémon, though Rattata and Raticate have also been called the Rat Pokémon.
** They all have at least one family member with a [[regional variant]] in Alola

===Origin===
{{bulbanews|On the Origin of Species: Sandshrew and Sandslash}}
Sandslash shares various physical traits with the {{wp|pangolin}}. It also draws from hedgehogs, porcupines, and echidnas due to its coloration and having spikes instead of scales. Both {{p|Sandshrew}} and Sandslash are mentioned to have poisonous claws, similar to how some species of the {{wp|shrew}} are poisonous.

====Name origin====
Sandslash is a combination of ''sand'' and ''slash'', referring to its long claws.

Sandpan may be a combination of ''sand'' and ''{{wp|pangolin}}''.
